Agency Sales Manager

Company Name Bauer Media Australia Company Location Melbourne

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 54 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Agency Sales Manager


Melbourne, Motoring


Bauer is looking for an\xa0Agency Manager\xa0to join our\xa0Melbourne\xa0based advertising sales team. This team is responsible for some of the largest and most exciting Agencies and clients in Melbourne across the Motoring industry.\xa0 Client solutions are at the heart of all we do, and we are looking for a self-started, driven, energetic & experienced Agency Manager to join our fun, hardworking and successful team.


The Agency Manager is accountable for delivering the territory budget (individual) and market share objectives for the Agency portfolio predominantly across the Motoring category. They champion the Bauer sales narrative in market, providing deep customer and media brand knowledge matched with commercial acumen across both print and digital media as it relates to Bauer’s business objectives.\xa0


Key responsibilities will include:


  • Work collaboratively with the Strategy and Brands teams in developing campaign solutions, both in response to market briefs or as proactive sales pitches across the portfolio
  • Manage effective conversion of pipeline opportunities

  • Ensure the needs of your designated client portfolio are met, whilst brands are fairly and appropriately represented across all platforms
  • Work closely with the Commercial Director to achieve revenue budget, manage yield and increase market share across the territory.

  • Ensure internal stakeholders are kept up to date through effective data capture and market intelligence

  • Ensure sound working relationships are maintained with internal and external stakeholders
  • Ensure reduced turnaround times are achieved with campaign managers

You will bring:


  • Ideally you will have proven experience in the media industry, with a strong and consistent background in cross platform media sales
  • As this role works predominantly across our amazing Motoring brands an interest or passion for the industry is desirable

  • Ability to extract high quality briefs, interpret briefs and write sales proposals
  • Ability to negotiate skilfully in tough situations with both internal and external groups
  • A team player with a professional and positive approach to their work

The WhichCar Network is the ultimate automotive site that has everything new car buyers need and car lovers want. It is powered by Australia’s premier motoring titles and provides reviews, advice and entertainment from respected brands such as Wheels, MOTOR, 4X4 and Street Machine. We cater for everyone, from mainstream shoppers to performance enthusiasts, and publish more than 600 stories a month written by experts with decades of experience.


Come join the team!!

Abigail Lawrence

Head of Talent at Bauer Media Australia

Sydney, New South Wales, Australia

The company


Our client is a Cutting edge FinTech business, consistently voted in the top 20 places to work in Australia. A leader in their market and a pioneer in their field.


This is an excellent opportunity for an experienced DevOps Engineer to join their technology group for a 6 months contract (likely to be extended).


The Role:


The successful candidate will work with multi-discipline expert team to implement, rollout and support the company across AWS, to ensure Security, Automated scalable solutions.


The DevOps Engineer will also have developer/system-admin hybrid skill who not only know how to find problems, but fix them, too.


About you:

  • You will be building and maintaining of our world-class cloud infrastructure, with key objectives in the areas of automation, availability, scalability, and security management.
  • You will help set the technical vision for the delivery of quality new products and create the enabling architecture and infrastructure backbone as required.
  • You will have a proven background in delivering Enterprise level services and support of existing platforms. This includes having completed conceptual and technical architecture designs and seen these through to build, test and deploy.


Hands- on experience in the following:

  • Linux/Unix Administration
  • Automation and configuration management tools specifically using Puppet, Bamboo
  • Ability to use a wide variety of open source technologies
  • Knowledge of best practices and IT operations in an always-up, always-available service
  • Middleware Systems such as Jboss, Apache and IBM MQ
  • Scripting technologies - Ruby and Python
  • Java based web platforms and technologies
  • GIT
  • Advanced knowledge and experience of AWS services specifically EC2, RDS, S3, CloudFormation, Lambda, CloudTrail, Config, Key Management Services, Certificate Manager, Cloudwatch, IAM, Security Groups, Network ACL and Cloudfront.

Senior Events Officer - Logistics

Permanent Full Time

Band 6 - $81,146 per annum plus super

An exciting opportunity has arisen for an experienced, dynamic and passionate Senior Events Officer to join our Arts and Culture Department.

You will contribute to the planning, delivery and support of high quality event services, festivals and programs in Frankston City building a positive image of the municipality. Your main responsibilities will include the planning, management and delivery of the logistics for all Council Major Events.

With your sound knowledge and experience within the events industry you will ensure all documentation and plans are compliant in regards to risk, emergency management, traffic, liquor licencing, warden briefings, site plans and much more. Your flexible nature, expertise and friendly approach will be an asset when working within a tight team and while providing direction, supervision and support to event contractors, casual staff and volunteers.

You will have a demonstrated ability and commitment to deliver great events with an understanding of all facets of event planning and delivery, including delivering large scale events.

Suitably qualified with relevant experience, you will be self-motivated, strategic and thrive in a fast-paced environment whilst being able to manage varying concurrent projects at once.

You will need to provide evidence of your right to work in Australia, certified copies of your qualifications, and a current Driver Licence. You must also be willing to provide a Pre-Employment Health Declaration and undertake a National Police Record Check.

Please address selection criteria as part of your application.

Digital Assistant (Social Media) & Digital Assistant (Websites)

Company Name Australian Grand Prix Corporation Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 415 views

Job description

Work in the fast lane! The Australian Grand Prix Corporation (AGPC) is seeking two Digital Assistants to join our hard-working Marketing team.

AGPC is responsible for staging two iconic international events, the Formula 1\xae Australian Grand Prix in Melbourne and the Australian Motorcycle Grand Prix in Phillip Island. We are internationally recognised and respected leaders on the world motorsport stage.

"Our people at AGPC" are a group of passionate and talented individuals who work hard all year to make these events possible. We have different specialist departments working towards a very clear common goal - providing Melbourne and Victoria with world-class international events.

Reporting to the Digital Manager, the two Digital Assistant roles have been split, with one focusing on social media and the other on AGPC's event websites (grandprix.com.au and motogp.com.au).

The roles present an exciting opportunity to work in a supportive, collaborative environment and both roles are full-time, seven-month contract positions.

The roles are ideal for candidates with an interest in digital marketing, brand and advertising, media and communications, content, sport, motorsport, entertainment and/or events.

Please specify in your cover letter which role you would prefer, Digital Assistant - Social Media or Digital Assistant - Websites. Please also include which team Daniel Ricciardo will drive for in 2019.

The successful candidates will be offered an immediate start.

About the Roles

AGPC is looking for people willing to work in a dynamic and fast-paced environment with the right attitude, a keen eye for detail and, most of all, the desire to learn and make a difference.

Digital Assistant - Social Media

Key roles and responsibilities:

  • Generate, publish and monitor social media content to continually engage and grow AGPC's social media channels.
  • Coordinate and deliver social media requirements for internal (e.g. other departments) and external (e.g. event sponsors) stakeholders.
  • Analyse statistics and other relevant information to improve social media effectiveness.

Digital Assistant - Website
Key roles and responsibilities:
  • Create and upload content and improve the functionality and design of AGPC's event websites.
  • Coordinate and deliver website requirements for internal (e.g. other departments) and external (e.g. event sponsors) stakeholders.
  • Analyse statistics (using Google Analytics) and other relevant information to improve website effectiveness.

Skills and experience you will bring:
  • 1-3 years' experience in digital communications
  • Enthusiasm and a desire to learn with a can-do attitude
  • Passion and appreciation for all things digital
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Experience generating online content, including copywriting
  • Strong attention to detail with the ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously
  • Understanding of the importance of brand and customer segments

851946671:
[

Campaign Manager: National Education Initiative

Company Name beyondblue Company Location Hawthorn, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 193 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

beyondblue\xa0has been selected as the provider of the new Mental Health in Education program which will launch in late 2018 to support mentally healthy educational environments across Australia. The National Education Initiative (NEI) aims to engage with educators in early learning services and primary and secondary schools across Australia in professional development activities to build mentally healthy children and young people.


beyondblue\xa0is seeking a Campaign Manager National Education Initiative (NEI) to join the Marketing, Communications and Fundraising team. Reporting to the Campaigns Lead, the Campaign Manager will work in close collaboration with the NEI team, creative and media partners, and be responsible for the implementation and optimisation of the marketing campaign to launch the National Education Initiative.

Some of the duties for this role are:

Campaign Management

  • Work under the Campaigns Lead at beyondblue, taking a strategic approach to implement and optimise an integrated advertising campaign for the NEI.
  • Lead close collaboration with the NEI team to transfer research, clinical and specialist insights into effective campaign marketing strategies.

Leadership and cross-organisation collaboration

  • Work in collaboration with the NEI team, Performance team, Content team, Media team and other internal stakeholders to leverage maximum application of skill and experience.
  • Establish and maintain strong working relationships with beyondblue’s\xa0media and creative agency to the maximum benefit of beyondblue and our audiences.


What you will bring to the role:

Strategic Marketing -\xa0Knowledge of principles and methods for constructing and promoting messages to inform and lead behaviour change

Brand Management - Knowledge of key principles and methods of effective brand management. This includes brand strategy controls and brand value

Project Management –\xa0Knowledge and skills in planning, resource identification and deployment, task and activity monitoring, reporting and overall program delivery against defined objectives, methods and outcomes. \xa0Experience in Excel or Gantt Chart project management valued

Stakeholder Management – Knowledge of principles and processes for effectively managing stakeholders. This includes stakeholder needs assessment, meeting quality standards for services, and evaluation of stakeholder satisfaction

Professional Empathy –\xa0Full awareness of and capacity to anticipate the sensitive impact of our messages on the public. Orientation towards seeking advice.


You will have a tertiary qualification in marketing, digital media or equivalent, you must be highly organised and capable of organising activities with no fuss, managing competing priorities, and remaining calm under pressure. Detailed orientated nature and possess exceptional communication skills.


What can we offer you?

Part of a friendly and highly skilled team of Marketing, Communications and Fundraising. The broader beyondblue\xa0family promotes collaboration and respect. Working at beyondblue\xa0offers flexibility, professional development and the opportunity to be a part of one of the leading mental health organisations in Australia. Benefits include Not-For-Profit salary packaging options, an employee assistance program and wellbeing initiatives. Our office is an easy walk from Glenferrie Station and our Social Squad will ensure that you get to enjoy some fun events in the workplace.

The Campaign Manager National Education Initiative is being offered on a full-time, 3 month fixed-term basis. \xa0Applications should include a current CV with a cover letter that includes why you feel you would be a great addition to this initiative. \xa0The position description located on our careers website (https://www.beyondblue.org.au/about-us/careers).\xa0

\xa0All applications should be submitted to: jobs@beyondblue.org.au

With the subject line: CAMPAIGN MANAGER\xa0NEI

Applications close at 5.00pm 6 September 2018.

Full Stack Developer

Company Name Outcome Health (Melbourne East GP Network trading as Outcome Health) Company Location Suite 3, Level 1, 5 Lakeside Drive , East Burwood, VIC 3151, AU

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 29 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

About the Opportunity


Outcome Health (OH) has recently pursued a web based reporting platform for its POpulation Level Analysis and Reporting (POLAR) suite of products. This change has allowed OH to create a developer position (with a focus on web) to integrate with the existing development team. The position will emphasise the continued use of web technologies to further push the boundaries of both existing and new POLAR application/reporting solutions.


This is a full-time, permanent position, based in Burwood East in Melbourne's eastern suburbs.

Reporting to the Chief Information Officer and working closely with the Enterprise Architect and Information Solutions Manager, the Full Stack Developer will be responsible for the development, maintenance and support of POLAR based products/components. This position represents a valuable part of the broader development team and will be required to actively participate in, and advise on, POLAR product development decisions.


This role would be well-suited to a developer with 5+ years experience, including using web technologies and/or someone with experience working in a startup environment.

To view the full position description and selection criteria, please click 'apply now'.


About the Benefits


This role provides a unique opportunity to join a successful team that thrives on innovation and pushing the technical boundaries of data analysis and customer engagement. As a brand new role, and working on a new, one-of-a-kind platform in the market, you will also have the ability to truly make your mark, within an organisation that prides itself on being a technology disrupter.


A competitive remuneration package is on offer, negotiable with the skills and experience you bring to the role. You will also have access to salary packaging, including FBT concessions, to further increase your take-home pay.


Outcome Health offers a family-friendly (and dog friendly!), flexible work environment with a flat, cohesive organisational structure. We boast high retention rates, high employee satisfaction, and are also conveniently located close to numerous modes of public transport, including a tram stop right outside the office.


So what are you waiting for? This opportunity won't last long - if you are an experienced Web Developer looking for your next big career move, Apply Now!
